data.name: AccountPlan_Info
data.value: This is the overview of the financial accounts in your bookkeeping ledger. You can do some maintenance from here, even if most of the daily operations should be delegated to the budget owners.

data.name: BalanceSheet_ContentHeader
data.comment: {0} is the organization name. The year follows immediately, so keep ending comma.

data.name: BalanceSheet_DownloadFileName
data.comment: Must ONLY contain A-Z, a-z characters - nothing accented!

data.name: BalanceSheet_EndYear
data.comment: The XXXX is replaced with year number.

data.name: BalanceSheet_Info
data.value: The Balance Sheet is an overview of assets and debts at a snapshot in time, and is used to see how results affect the overall financial health of the organization. You may also want to look at the profit-and-loss statement which is the overview of income and expenditure.

data.name: BalanceSheet_StartYear
data.comment: The XXXX is replaced with year number.

data.name: ProfitLossStatement_ContentHeader
data.comment: The {0} is the organization name. The year number follows this string.

data.name: ProfitLossStatement_DownloadFileName
data.comment: Must ONLY contain A-Z, a-z characters - nothing accented!

data.name: ProfitLossStatement_Info
data.value: The P&L is an overview of income and expenditures, which are grouped by budgets or cost/income type. The sum of all income and expenditure is the yearly result. You may also want to look at the balance sheet which is the overview of assets and debts.

data.name: ProfitLossStatement_Results
data.comment: Footer on P&L statement

data.name: ProfitLossStatement_Ytd
data.comment: Year To Date

data.name: ResyncExternalAccount_Info
data.value:
If your bookkeeping in Swarmops has gotten out of sync with your bank records for whatever technical or human reason, you can resynchronize them here by uploading a master file that covers the time frame you need to resync.

Warning: this is a time-consuming process that may do a lot of changes to your bookkeeping. Do not use unless you have discovered a mismatch in the records vs. your bank.

(You will get a chance to review proposed changes before they are committed to your financial records.)

data.name: SetRootBudgets_BudgetOwnerHeader
data.comment: Displayed above editables

data.name: SetRootBudgets_Info
data.value: This is where the root budgets are set for each budget year. After these are set, each budget owner suballocates funds within their respective budget trees.

data.name: SetRootBudgets_PageHeader
data.comment: The {0} is replaced with the organization's name.

data.name: SetRootBudgets_PageTitle
data.comment: Displayed above main content

data.name: SetRootBudgets_SetNewBudgets
data.comment: Text on submit button

data.name: UploadBankFiles_BankScreenshot
data.comment: Displayed as header above modally zoomed screenshot

data.name: UploadBankFiles_DownloadDataSince
data.value: (The most recent data in Swarmops in {0} is from {1:yyyy-MMM-dd}. You should download bank data from at least {2:yyyy-MMM-dd}.)
data.comment: Displayed to help user determine scope of bank download

data.name: UploadBankFiles_DownloadDataSince_Paypal
data.value: (Paypal will tell you the time of the last transaction download. Download all transactions from that point in time, adding some three days of overlap.)
data.comment: Displayed instead of date of last transaction in the case of Paypal.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_DownloadInstructions
data.comment: Header above instructions for generation of the bank file type selected.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_DownloadInstructions_BankgiroSEFile
data.value: Different banks have different means of obtaining the BGMAX format file. On SEB, you go to Payments and File communications to see a list of files to retrieve. Other banks will vary. In any case, upload them here.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_DownloadInstructions_PaypalFile
data.value:
Log on to PayPal. Go to Your Account, and under the History menu, select Download History. Select Custom Date Range, enter the range since last download (as indicated) plus some overlap, and most importantly, select Tab Delimited - All Activity. Click Download.

Some time will pass before you get a mail from PayPal saying that the file is ready for download. It will be named download.txt. Upload this file.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_DownloadInstructions_PaysonFile
data.value: Log on to Payson. Go to the History tab, and click Export history. The downloaded file will be named Payson_Export_[date].xls. Upload this file.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_DownloadInstructions_SebAccountFile
data.value: Open SEB's internet bank. Go to your account, and enter the date span you wish to download in the search box. Press filter. After that, click the link to save the account history. A popup will appear. Choose csv and tab separated, then save. The downloaded file will be named Kontohändelser.csv. Upload this file.
data.comment: Only translate to languages where SEB is active.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_ErrorBalance
data.value:
The file contained {0:N0} transactions. {1:N0} transactions have been successfully imported into the {2} bookkeeping account. ({3:N0} transactions were duplicates.)

However, the bank balance does not match the records in Swarmops. This is usually due to missing transactions. Please upload a transaction list with a larger time span to make sure that Swarmops sees all transactions.

Swarmops's bookkeeping account is currently not in sync with that of the bank.
data.comment: Displayed when import successful, but end balance out of sync. Assumes plural along all pasted numbers.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_ErrorInterpretation
data.value:
The bank file could not be imported.

This has one of three reasons: you missed some detail in the download instructions, the bank has changed its format, or you accidentally uploaded the wrong file entirely (like a photo from your last party instead of the transactions list). No transactions were imported at all. Please retry.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_ExpectedFile
data.comment: The name of the expected file for uploading.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_FileImportedHeader
data.comment: Displayed as header after successful processing

data.name: UploadBankFiles_FileImportedHeader_ErrorBalance
data.value: File Imported, But Data Out Of Sync
data.comment: Displayed as header after a good processing that ended in sync failure

data.name: UploadBankFiles_FileType
data.comment: can be Account Statement or Payments File

data.name: UploadBankFiles_ImportError
data.comment: Displayed as header on import failure

data.name: UploadBankFiles_ImportResults
data.value:
The file contained {0:N0} transactions. {1:N0} transactions have been successfully imported into the {2} bookkeeping account. ({3:N0} transactions were duplicates.)

After import, the account balance in Swarmops matches that of the bank.
data.comment: Displayed on successful import. Assumes plural among all pasted numbers.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_Info
data.value: Here, you can upload files from your bank or payment provider into your organization's bookkeeping. Examples include account history and payments received.
data.comment: Displayed in sidebar on page.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_PageTitle
data.comment: Displayed above main content.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_PaymentAllDuplicates
data.value: However, they were all duplicates of payment information that was previously uploaded. No new payment information has been imported to Swarmops.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_PaymentCount
data.comment: none|one|many

data.name: UploadBankFiles_PaymentGroupCount
data.value: no payment groups|one payment group|{0} payment groups
data.comment: none|one|many

data.name: UploadBankFiles_PaymentSummary2
data.value: {0} {1:N2} in payments were imported, distributed over {2} across {3}.
data.comment: like EUR 2,102.00 in 3 payments across 2 groups

data.name: UploadBankFiles_PaymentSummaryDuplicates
data.value: There was also some duplicate information ({0} across {1}).

data.name: UploadBankFiles_ResultsBad
data.value:
The file could not be read as an input file to this bank.

There are several reasons this could happen: the file may be corrupt, the bank may have silently changed its file format, or you uploaded the wrong file entirely. Please try again.
data.comment: Displayed when the input file can't be parsed, before import attempt.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_ResultsGood
data.value:
The file has been successfully imported. {0:N0} new transactions imported; {1:N0} discarded as duplicates of what was already in Swarmops. The account balance in Swarmops matches that of the bank.

The file contained transactions from {2:yyyy-MMM-dd} to {3:yyyy-MMM-dd}.
data.comment: Zero is new transaction count, one is duplicate transaction count, two and three are lowest and highest dates found in file. Pay attention to date format and adjust to culture.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_ResultsQuestionable
data.value:
The file was imported, but the resulting account balance mismatches.

After importing {0:N0} transactions (and discarding {1:N0} duplicates), the entire file has been processed. However, the resulting account balance in Swarmops is not the same as that of the bank statement; there is a difference of {3} {2:N2}.

Please try uploading a fresh account statement. If that still produces a mismatch, you may need to try resynchronizing the bank account with a comprehensive account statement file.
data.comment: Displayed on successful import, but the resulting balance is off compared to the account statement file that was just uploaded. 2 is the diff, 3 is the currency.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_SelectAccount
data.comment: Select prompt for the financial account in the organization's bookkeeping.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_SelectBankAndAccount
data.value: Select File Type And Account For Upload

data.name: UploadBankFiles_SelectBankFileType
data.comment: Header above several bank logos, prompting a selection of bank.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_UploadAnother
data.comment: Displayed as header after uploading one file

data.name: UploadBankFiles_UploadBankFile
data.comment: Displayed as header above download instructions / upload form

data.name: ViewOutstandingAccounts_GridHeaderAction
data.comment: keep short

data.name: ViewOutstandingAccounts_GridHeaderAmount
data.comment: keep short

data.name: ViewOutstandingAccounts_GridHeaderExpectedCloseDate
data.comment: keep short

data.name: ViewOutstandingAccounts_GridHeaderId
data.comment: keep short

data.name: ViewOutstandingAccounts_GridHeaderOpenedDate
data.comment: keep short

data.name: ViewOutstandingAccounts_Info
data.value: This page lets you verify the outstanding and unsettled accounts (expenses, invoices, cash advances, etc.) at the current point in time or at the time of closing of any previous ledger.

data.name: AccountPlan_Edit_ActiveLong
data.value: Is this account open for transactions?

data.name: AccountPlan_Edit_AdministrativeLong
data.value: Are transactions here excluded from 2-D reports?

data.name: AccountPlan_Edit_BudgetBalance
data.comment: foo, bar replaced on load with actual values

data.name: AccountPlan_Edit_ExpensableLong
data.value: Can people use this account for expense reports?

data.name: AccountPlan_Edit_HeaderAutomation
data.comment: Automatic connections to bank, blockchain etc.

data.name: AccountPlan_ExpensesBudgetsAreNegative
data.value: This is an Expenses account. Such accounts normally have a budget in the negative, since they drain assets from the organization. Your proposed budget was changed to negative.
data.comment: Displayed as a message box

data.name: InspectLedgers_Header_For
data.comment: "inspect [accountdropdown] FOR [year] [month]"

data.name: InspectLedgers_Header_Inspect
data.comment: "INSPECT [accountdropdown] for [year] [month]"

data.name: InspectLedgers_FlaggingNotAvailable
data.value: Flagging a transaction for closer inspection is not yet implemented. It is scheduled for one of the early Swarmops Red sprints, some time late 2015Q1.

data.name: InspectLedgers_Info
data.value: This is the raw underlying Venetian bookkeeping ledgers for the organization's finances. You can study them here in detail for auditing purposes. You're currently watching a P&L account, so signs are reversed - income is negative and expenses positive due to how Venetian double bookkeeping works.

data.name: InspectLedgers_InspectNotAvailable
data.value: Inspecting a single transaction is not yet implemented. It is scheduled for one of the early Swarmops Red sprints, late 2015Q1.

data.name: InspectLedgers_NoTransactions
data.value: There are no transactions in this account for the selected time period.

data.name: InspectLedgers_OutboundBalanceZeroToDate
data.comment: Displayed if the end-balance date isn't reached yet

data.name: InspectLedgers_PleaseSelectAccount
data.comment: Displayed initially and when no valid account selected

data.name: InspectLedgers_TransactionId
data.comment: Keep VERY short.

data.name: UploadBankFiles_ResultsPayments
data.value: The payments file was successfully imported. {1:N0} payment(s) in {0:N0} group(s), totalling {3} {2:N2}, were imported.
data.comment: Arguments 0-3 in order: 0 PaymentGroupCount, 1 PaymentCount, 2 PaymentAmountTotal, 3 Currency

data.name: UploadBankFiles_ResultsPaymentsWithDupes
data.value:
The payments file was successfully imported. {1:N0} payment(s) in {0:N0} group(s), totalling {3} {2:N2}, were imported.

(There were also {5:N0} duplicate payment(s) in {4:N0} group(s).)
data.comment: Arguments 0-5 in order: 0 PaymentGroupCount, 1 PaymentCount, 2 PaymentAmountTotal, 3 Currency, 4 DuplicatePaymentGroupCount, 5 DuplicatePaymentCount

data.name: AccountPlan_AddAccount
data.comment: Displayed as link in parens after account group name

data.name: AccountPlan_NewAccount
data.comment: the name of newly-created accounts, before rename

data.name: AccountPlan_DebtBalancesAreNegative
data.value: This is a Liabilities account. Such accounts normally have a balance in the negative, since they represent negative assets in the organization. Your entered initial balance was changed to negative.

data.name: AccountPlan_Edit_InitialBalance
data.comment: {0} is the first ledger year in Swarmops. {1} is the currency code.

data.name: AccountPlan_Options_ShowInactive
data.comment: The {0} is the number of inactive accounts.

data.name: AccountPlan_ProjectedLoss
data.comment: "Projected" as in "Budgeted". {0} is year.

data.name: AccountPlan_ProjectedProfit
data.comment: "Projected" as in "Budgeted". {0} is year.

data.name: TaxForms_Payroll_AdditiveTax
data.comment: If applicable, translate to local legal tax term

data.name: TaxForms_Payroll_DeductedTax
data.comment: If applicable, translate to local legal tax term

data.name: TaxForms_Payroll_Info
data.value: View cheat sheets (completed tax forms) for the organization payroll, which are easy for you to copy to your actual tax forms, or possibly even print as is. Performance and actual forms vary by country and sometimes depend on third-party code and plugins.

data.name: TaxForms_Payroll_TaxFormsMonthlyHeader
data.comment: The {0} is the organization name. A country selector follows (imagine a "France" tacked on to the end).

data.name: InspectLedgers_EditingTransactionX
data.comment: The transaction id is replaced client-side on display

data.name: InspectLedgers_InspectingTransactionX
data.comment: The transaction id is replaced client-side on display

data.name: InspectLedgers_HeaderAddTransactionRow
data.comment: (you can't really edit a transaction, just add more rows to it)

data.name: InspectLedgers_HeaderAutoTransactionTracking
data.comment: (this means the transaction is locked from editing)

data.name: InspectLedgers_TxDetail_CombinedWith
data.comment: Inserted between transaction causes.

data.name: InspectLedgers_TxDetail_InvoiceX
data.comment: the {1} is the supplier name

data.name: InspectLedgers_TxDetail_ThisIsPayoutX
data.value: This is Payout #{0:N0}. It's a payout for

data.name: InspectLedgers_TxDetail_ValidatedByX
data.comment: "Document" refers to receipts, invoices, etc.

data.name: InspectLedgers_TxDetail_PaidOutBy
data.comment: As in "payout executed by": who actually paid the money?

data.name: InspectLedgers_TxDetail_SalaryDetail
data.value: Base salary {0} {1:N2}, gross adjustments {2:+N2;-N2;none}, gross salary {3:N2}, deducted tax {4:N2}, net adjustments {5:+N2;-N2;none}, payout {6:N2}.
data.comment: The "none"s in the format strings need to be translated.
